Record.Value: Gas Mixing
Practical Training: Stage IV
Extend your skills in the realm of gas mixing and filtration to create atmospheres, fuels and more.
Welcome Cadet! Deployed as a Stationeer, you'll need to create fuels and atmospheres for far-flung ODA bases. So let's explore your knowledge of gas filtering and mixing.

Your base needs work, but your welder's out of gas, so you have to create more fuel. First, you need a source of oxygen. Luckily, plants create O2 from CO2. There's CO2 in your suit waste tank. So vent it in the hydroponics room.
Open suit waste tank
Close suit waste tank
In order to collect oxygen from the air in this room, build an active vent in the highlighted position. Use this to pump the atmosphere to your filtration system.
Get active vent from crate
Build active vent in highlighted position
Now, move through the airlock to the atmospherics room to build your gas mixing system.
Enter atmospherics room
To extract oxygen from the hydroponic room atmosphere, build a filtration unit in the highlighted position.
Get atmospherics kit from crate
Build filtration unit in highlighted position
To pump the hydroponic room's atmosphere into the filtration unit, complete the green oxygen pipe network.
Get pipes from crate
Complete oxygen pipe network

The filtration unit separates usable gas from waste gas. You must dispose of your waste gas or loud, unpleasant things can happen. Connect the filtration unit to the waste network, to ensure any unneeded gas is expelled into the infinite void.
Get second pipe kit from crate
Complete the waste network
A filtration unit can filter out two gases simultaneously, but right now you just need oxygen - so add an oxygen filter in the unit.
Get oxygen filter from crate
Insert oxygen filter in filtration unit
To reduce the chance of your fuel accidentally igniting, it's a good idea to chill your gas. Passing your pipes outside and adding pipe radiators is a good way to cool them.
Get pipe radiator from crate
Add pipe radiator in highlighted position
The ice crusher is also a good way to obtain gases from ice ores. Connect the ice crusher's gas output to the 'volatile' gas network.
Get Ice Crusher from crate
Build Ice Crusher in highlighted position
Use Iron Sheets on the Ice Crusher
Complete the Ice crusher with cables

Fuel has two components: oxygen and volatile gas. Get volatile ice from the mining belt in the crate, then add some to the ice crusher for processing. Note: volatiles sublime rapidly, but not inside the ore belt or crusher.
Get mining belt from crate
Add volatiles to ice crusher
Now you need to connect your oxygen and volatile networks using a gas mixer. This will let you blend your fuel mix at the correct ratio, avoiding the disappointment of a bad mix.
Get gas mixer from crate
Build gas mixer in highlighted position
To make sure you don't overpressure your canister, add a pressure regulator. It's an important lesson for Stationeers who want to keep existing.
Get pressure regulator from crate
Build pressure regulator in highlighted position.
Valves let you open and close pipes, to control the flow of gas and liquids. We've already placed one for you. Add the other one to your oxygen network.
Get the pipe valve from the crate
Place valve in highlighted position
Cannisters are recharged by being put in tank storage units. Tank storage units attach directly to pipe networks. Build one in the indicated spot.
Get tank storage unit from crate
Build tank storage unit in highlighted position
Excellent! Your gas network is now set up. Insert the empty tank from your welder into the storage unit, so it's ready to be charged up.
Retrieve canister from storage unit
Insert fuel canister from welder into tank storage unit
To find the correct fuel ratio for filling your tank, consult the Stationpedia Canister (Fuel) page.
Set gas mixer valve to 66:34
Consult Canister (Fuel) page in Stationpedia
Close Stationpedia
Good, now set the pressure on the regulator. A safe pressure for canisters is 1950kPa, although they can tolerate up to almost 10MPa.
Set pressure on regulator to 1950kPa
Great work Cadet! Everything is ready. You can safely begin turning on your equipment to start producing fuel.
Hydroponics room: Turn on active vent
Turn on ice crusher
Turn on filtration unit
Turn on gas mixer
Turn on pressure regulator
The volatiles and oxygen are currently waiting paitently in the pipes. Open the valves to let them flow into through the gas mixer into your welder canister.
Open volatiles pipe valve
Open oxygen pipe valve
Stirling work, Cadet. Your fuel canister is now refilled. You can insert it into your welder.
Return fuel canister to welder
The ODA is impressed, Cadet. You can be trusted to filter and mix combustible fuels. Excellent progress. Press the mysterious blue button to transmit your results.
Open suit UI
Select waste tank
Complete the airlock
Good work, Cadet. You can now finish this room by completing the airlock with your fully refueled welder.
Equip tablet from backpack
Insert Atmos Analyzer into tablet
Turn on tablet to scan gas pipes
Turn off tablet after scanning
Excellent. Use your tablet to check that oxygen is entering the pipe.
Hydroponics room: Set active vent to 'inward'
